#: Language implementations vary on the issue of missing input variables.
In this set of test cases, the input variable is left out of the definition,
and the generator would need to handle the language implementation.

cases.description: rna complement of cytosine is guanine
cases.msg: No, the rna complement of cytosine is guanine.

cases.description: rna complement of guanine is cytosine
cases.msg: No, the rna complement of guanine is cytosine.

cases.description: rna complement of thymine is adenine
cases.msg: No, the rna complement of thymine is adenine.

cases.description: rna complement of adenine is uracil
cases.msg: No, the rna complement of adenine is uracil.
No, the rna complement of ACGTGGTCTTAA is UGCACCAGAAUU.

cases.description: dna complement of cytosine is guanine
cases.msg: No, the dna complement of cytosine is guanine.

cases.description: dna complement of guanine is cytosine
cases.msg: No, the dna complement of guanine is cytosine.

cases.description: dna complement of uracil is adenine
cases.msg: No, the dna complement of uracil is adenine.

cases.description: dna complement of adenine is thymine
cases.msg: No, the dna complement of adenine is thymine.
No, the dna complement of UGAACCCGACAUG is ACTTGGGCTGTAC.
Dna must raise an exception on invalid input!
Rna must raise an exception on invalid input!

cases.description: dna raises argument error on completely invalid input
cases.msg: Dna must raise an exception on complelely invalid input!

cases.description: rna raises argument error on completely invalid input
cases.msg: Rna must raise an exception on complelely invalid input!

cases.description: dna raises argument error on partially invalid input
cases.msg: Dna must raise an exception on partially invalid input!

cases.description: rna raises argument error on partially invalid input
cases.msg: Rna must raise an exception on partially invalid input!
